Solomon Duskis wrote:
>    If the client was a browser, I'd say Javascript :). REST does allow 
> for downloading logic from the server, in the form of Code-on-Demand 
> (http://www.ics.uci.edu/~fielding/pubs/dissertation/rest_arch_style.htm#sec_5_1_7). 
> In other words, "in REST there IS such client-side library available . "

Also, if the representations are XML, XSLT is a form of Code-on-Demand.
There are a number of RESTful systems we developed in my workplace that do
just that.

K.
